DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Laboratory Improvement Act Certificate Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The alphanumeric number that signifies the clinical laboratory improvement act certification.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to a document earned by a laboratory testing facility to ensure the accuracy, reliability and timeliness of patient test results regardless of where the test was performed, and also to determine if laboratories are achieving those standards.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A Federal law establishing quality standards for all laboratory testing to ensure the accuracy, reliability and timeliness of patient test results regardless of where the test was performed, and also to determine if laboratories are achieving those standards.

Concepts.definition: A Federal law establishing quality standards for all laboratory testing to ensure the accuracy, reliability and timeliness of patient test results regardless of where the test was performed and also to determine if laboratories are achieving those standards.

Property.preferredDefinition: A document earned by a person indicating that the person has specific knowledge, skills, or abilities in the view of a certifying body.  Similarly, a document indicating that a product or process is suitable or in working order for a specific purpose.

Concepts.definition: A document earned by a person indicating that the person has specific knowledge, skills, or abilities in the view of a certifying body.  Similarly, a document indicating that a product or process is suitable or in working order for a specific purpose.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The alphanumeric number that indicates the laboratory certificate.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: groups, institutions, or clinical facilities that conduct clinical research or tests, or analyze clinical data.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Laboratory; a workplace for the conduct of scientific research.:A document earned by a person indicating that the person has specific knowledge, skills, or abilities in the view of a certifying body. Similarly, a document indicating that a product or process is suitable or in working order for a specific purpose. :Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products.

A document earned by a person indicating that the person has specific knowledge, skills, or abilities in the view of a certifying body.  Similarly, a document indicating that a product or process is suitable or in working order for a specific purpose.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)
